Adult male.description: Scarlet Tanagers—including males, females, and immatures—have black or blackish wings that contrast with the body, unlike Summer Tanagers.

Female.description: Female Scarlet Tanagers have darker blackish wings whereas female/immature Summer Tanagers have yellowish wings.
Female/immature Western Tanagers have blackish wings as well as bold wingbars, whereas Summer Tanagers have yellower unmarked wings.

Adult male.description: Hepatic Tanagers have gray cheek patches and a grayish tinted back whereas adult male Summer Tanagers are entirely red. Also note the round head on Hepatic versus a slightly crested head on Summer Tanagers.

Female/immature male.description: Female/immature Hepatic Tanagers have darker bills than female/immature Summer Tanagers which have pale pinkish or horn-colored bills. They also have a grayish face and back that Summers lack.

Male.description: Male Northern Cardinals have a long, pointed crest, black feathers around the face, and a heavy, triangular, reddish bill unlike adult male Summer Tanagers, which are entirely red with a longer, thinner bill.
